meanings.definition: Lacking the necessary power, skill, or means.
meanings.sent1: She felt unable to lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: The young child was unable to reach the top shelf.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked unable to catch the fast mouse.
meanings.sent4: The old car seemed unable to climb the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The broken clock was unable to tell the correct time.

meanings.definition: Lacking the necessary physical or mental ability.
meanings.sent1: He was unable to solve the difficult puzzle.
meanings.sent2: The injured bird was unable to fly.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat looked unable to catch the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her tired legs felt unable to climb another step.
meanings.sent5: The rusty lock was unable to keep the door closed.
